Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2010 09:19PM LisaSec wrote: Hello Ladies! I went in for my simulation today and was told they could not do it because I have an area that became infected after my bmx and the wound has not completely healed.  I will go back on 9/10 for a "skin check" and if everything is good they will do my simulation at that time.  Then they will start my rads on 9/17.  I understand why they want to wait, but the delay is frustrating. Love & Hugs to you all! Lisa

Posts.Content: May 16, 2010 03:28PM LisaSec wrote: Sherry - or anyone else with information, this is all new to me.  I have just joined the forum.  You mentioned you had your sentinel node / lumpectomy recently.  Can you tell me what to really expect from that procedure?  I am trying to plan ahead and have no idea what I am walking into.  Any input will be appreciated.
Posts.Title: I got my date...May 17 bmx..and now I have weird questions... 1WonderWoman Sherry9316

Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2010 03:35PM LisaSec wrote: Hi ladies!  I had bmx with no node involvement and opted for immediate reconstruction as I was led to believe I would not need rads.  Initially, I had partial mx with positive margins then opted for bmx in July but once again margins were not clean. I have been told I will have 25 sessions. For me the difference in recurrence percentage was significant so my DH and I agreed that rads was the appropriate path.
Posts.Title: Just curious - who had a mx and still had to have rads? Houndmommy LisaSec
